name: Amazon Web Services
description: Supports Amazon Web Services.

name: Microsoft Azure
description: Connects to Microsoft Azure and imports metrics and logfiles into Axiom. Read access must be granted in order for the collection to succeed.

name: CircleCI
description: Connects to CircleCI and imports logs and metrics and notifies about running and failing builds..

name: Docker Engine
description: Provides access to Docker Engine container metrics. The provided configuration parameters will be transformed to the Docker equivalent environment variables.

name: Elasticsearch
description: Provides access to Elasticsearch cluster health and node metrics. Be advised, that configuration validation succeeds every time because credentials can not be authenticated without actually performing metric collection. Make sure to double check the entered configuration parameters.

name: Google Cloud Platform
description: Connects to the Google Cloud Platform and imports metrics and logs from Stackdriver. Read access to Stackdriver must be granted in order for the metric and log collection to succeed.

name: GitHub
description: Connects to GitHub and collects events and metrics from repositories.

name: Gitlab
description: Connects to GitLab and collects metrics about repositories and activity logs.

name: Gitter
description: Collects gitter metrics.

name: Apache Hadoop
description: Provides access to Apache Hadoop metrics.

name: HAProxy
description: Provides access to HAProxy metrics. In order to collect metrics the stats endpoint must be enabled.

name: Heroku
description: Fetches Heroku metrics.

name: MongoDB
description: Provides access to MongoDB server status metrics. The provided configuration parameters will be transformed to a mongo url: mongodb://[username[:password]@][host].

name: MySQL
description: Provides access to MySQL metrics. The provided configuration parameters will be transformed to a mysql url: [username[:password]@][tcp(host)]/database[?flags].

name: Nginx
description: Provides access to Nginx metrics. In order to collect metrics, module stub_status must be enabled. See: http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_stub_status_module.html#stub_status

name: NPM
description: Connects to the NPM registry and imports metrics about provided packages. It also catches license and version changes and reports those as events.

name: Ping
description: Uses ICMP to detect the liveness of configured targets.

name: PostgreSQL
description: Provides access to PostgreSQL metrics. The provided configuration parameters will be transformed to a postgres url: postgres://[username[:password]@][host]/database[?flags].

name: Redis
description: Provides access to Redis metrics and slow query log entries. The provided configuration parameters will be transformed to a redis url: redis://[username[:password]@][host]/database[?flags].

name: Slack
description: Collects Slack metrics.

name: Apache Spark
description:
There are two recommended approaches for getting Apache Spark metrics into Axiom:

  1. Use the official Prometheus JMX Exporter which also has an example config for Apache Spark. The JMX Exporter can be collected by the Prometheus integration.

  2. Use the community maintained prometheus metrics sink. Metrics will be pushed to a Prometheus Pushgateway and can be collected by the Prometheus integration.

name: Apache Storm
description: Provides access to Apache storm metrics. Is is also able to perform HTTP BasicAuth.

name: TCP Check
description: Uses TCP to detect the liveness of configured targets.

name: Travis CI
description: Connects to Travis CI and imports logs and metrics and notifies about running and failing builds.
